sections.title: Introduction
sections.content:
Table content:
Hardware | PCI/USB ID | Working?
Touchpad |  | Yes
Keyboard |  | Yes
GPU | 8086:46a6 | Yes
Wi-Fi | 8086:51f0 | Yes
Webcam | 8086:465d | No
Bluetooth | 8087:0033 | Yes
Audio | 8086:51c8 | Yes
Fingerprint reader | 04f3:0c7f | No

sections.title: Webcam
sections.content: The Acer Swift 3 uses the Intel Evo platform and a MIPI IPU6 camera, which has had little success in operating on Linux systems. Intel has available drivers, but these drivers require special userspace libraries and are not compatible with V4L2.

sections.title: Accessibility
sections.content: The firmware interface on the Acer Swift 3 is simple and keyboard-oriented, so it should be trivial to use with OCR devices.

sections.title: Firmware
sections.content:
Note: **This article or section needs expansion.** This article or section needs expansion.

This article or section needs expansion.

sections.title: Secure Boot
sections.content:
Secure Boot is enabled by default in the BIOS.

Due to Acer's obsolete BIOS, the following messages are to be expected at boot:

```
[    1.173096] integrity: Problem loading X.509 certificate -65
[    1.174519] integrity: Problem loading X.509 certificate -65
```

sections.title: Function Keys
sections.content:
Table content:
Key | Visible?1 | Marked?2 | Effect
Fn+F1 | Yes | Yes | XF86AudioMute
Fn+F2 | Yes | Yes | XF86AudioLowerVolume
Fn+F3 | Yes | Yes | XF86AudioRaiseVolume
Fn+F4 | No | Yes | Does nothing?
Fn+F5 | Yes | Yes | XF86MonBrightnessDown
Fn+F6 | Yes | Yes | XF86MonBrightnessUp
Fn+F7 | Yes | Yes | Inputs Super+p
Fn+F8 | Untested | Yes | Unknown
Fn+F9 | Yes | Yes | XF86RFKill
Fn+F10 | No | Yes | Disables touchpad
Fn+F11 | No | Yes | Changes keyboard backlight brightness
Fn+PrtScn | Yes | Yes | Print
Fn+Del | Yes | Yes | Insert
Fn+RightCtrl | Yes | Yes | Menu
Fn+Up | Yes | Yes | Prior
Fn+Down | Yes | Yes | Next
Fn+Left | Yes | Yes | Home
Fn+Right | Yes | Yes | End

1. The key is visible to xev and similar tools.
1. The physical key has a symbol on it, which describes its function.
